WindowScreenY.summary: The Window.screenY read-only property returns the vertical distance, in CSS pixels, of the top border of the user's browser viewport to the top edge of the screen.

blockquote.para: Note: An alias of screenY was implemented across modern browsers in more recent times â€” . This was originally supported only in IE but was introduced everywhere due to popularity.

WindowScreenY.value: A number equal to the number of CSS pixels from the top edge of the browser viewport to the top edge of the screen.
